Package com.flipkart.dao

Interface FlipFitUserDAOInterface

All Known Implementing Classes:
FlipFitUserDAOImpl
public interface FlipFitUserDAOInterface
This interface defines methods to interact with user-related data in the FlipFit application.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    int
    authenticateUser(String userEmail, String userPassword, int roleId)
    Authenticates a user based on email, password, and role ID.
    boolean
    changeUserPassword(int userId, String userPassword)
    Changes the password of a user in the database.
    int
    createUser(int userId, String userEmail, String userPassword, int roleId)
    Creates a new user in the database.

  • Method Details

    • authenticateUser

      int authenticateUser(String userEmail, String userPassword, int roleId)
      Authenticates a user based on email, password, and role ID.
      Parameters:
      userEmail - The email of the user to authenticate.
      userPassword - The password of the user to authenticate.
      roleId - The role ID of the user to authenticate.
      Returns:
      If authentication succeeds, returns the user ID; if the password does not match, returns -1; if user not found, returns 0.

    • createUser

      int createUser(int userId, String userEmail, String userPassword, int roleId)
      Creates a new user in the database.
      Parameters:
      userId - The ID of the user being created.
      userEmail - The email of the user being created.
      userPassword - The password of the user being created.
      roleId - The role ID of the user being created.
      Returns:
      The generated user ID if creation is successful, otherwise returns 0.

    • changeUserPassword

      boolean changeUserPassword(int userId, String userPassword)
      Changes the password of a user in the database.
      Parameters:
      userId - The ID of the user whose password is being changed.
      userPassword - The new password for the user.
      Returns:
      True if password change is successful, false otherwise.
